news_header: Commerzbank announced plans to cut about 3,900 jobs, or 10% of its workforce, by 2028 to maintain independence from UniCredit's takeover attempts. The bank aims for a net profit of €4.2 billion by 2028, up from €2.7 billion last year, citing efficiency gains from digitalization.
news_original_title: Commerzbank plans job cuts, new goals to fend off UniCredit
news_text: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has criticized UniCredit's actions as hostile, while Commerzbank's management is working to highlight the bank's value potential.
